show_menu.title: Magic Areas Options
show_menu.description: Magic Areas does basic presence detection by default but you can unleash its full power by configuring advanced state tracking, tune in your presence tracking parameters and enabling our magic features! Options are not saved unless you select `Save & Exit`.

feature_conf_health.title: Health sensor
feature_conf_health.description: You can choose a set of `binary sensor` device classes that will be tracked by this health sensor that can be used in automations.

feature_conf_light_groups.title: Light Groups
feature_conf_light_groups.description: Magic Areas creates these four (plus a global one) [light groups](https://github.com/jseidl/hass-magic_areas/wiki/Light-Groups) (if you assign lights to them) for you to use. These by default are plain light groups but can be automatically controlled if you assign them to area states and enable the light control switch (that will be created when you enable this feature). All lights will be turned off when an area is cleared. Additional states can be unlocked by configuring `Advanced area state tracking`.

data.overhead_lights_act_on: When should overhead lights be controlled?
data.sleep_lights_states: States which sleep lights are turned on
data.sleep_lights_act_on: When should sleep lights be controlled?
data.accent_lights_states: States which accent lights are turned on

data.task_lights_act_on: When should task lights be controlled?

data_description.overhead_lights_states: Configure which area states will trigger this light group. Light groups will be turned `on` while area is on this state and `off` if the area loses these states. For example, if you want the light to stay `on` after an extended period of time, you need to select the `extended` state too.
data_description.overhead_lights_act_on: Select if this light group should be controlled only when an area first gets occupied, only on area state changes or both.

For example, if you want the light to stay `on` after an extended period of time, you need to select the `extended` state too.

feature_conf_presence_hold.title: Presence Hold
feature_conf_presence_hold.description: Creates a switch that will hold an area occupied while it's on. You can configure a timeout to have the switch automatically turn off after a certain period of time, if you often see yourself leaving it on.

data.presence_hold_timeout: Time after the switch will be automatically turned `off`. (0 = timeout disabled).

feature_conf_area_aware_media_player.title: Feature: Area-aware media player
feature_conf_area_aware_media_player.description: Creates a media player device that will forward play calls to other media players in occupied areas only. This is useful if you want to use TTS notifications but only want to notify areas that are occupied to avoid notifying media players in vacant areas. This feature has configuration options in each area but it is only created if you have a `Global` meta area.

data.notification_devices: Media Player devices used for broadcasting
data.notification_states: Play notifications devices only when on these states

data_description.notification_states: Notifications will only be played when an area is on this state. Using `extended` will ensure you don't get notified in rooms you just passed by and not selecting `sleep` will prevent notifications while on this mode.

feature_conf_aggregates.title: Feature: Sensor aggregates
feature_conf_aggregates.description: If you have multiple `sensors` (or `binary sensors`) of the same type, Magic Areas can group then into a single entity allowing you to have averages (or sums) of sensors or combined state of binary sensors. It's even useful if you only currently have one sensor of each kind as it allows you to use the aggregate in automations and expand in the future without having to re-write your automations.

data.aggregates_min_entities: Minimum number of entities of the same device class required to create aggregates.
data.aggregates_binary_sensor_device_classes: Binary sensor device classes to be aggregated.
data.aggregates_sensor_device_classes: Sensor device classes to be aggregated.

data_description.aggregates_illuminance_threshold: Magic Areas will create a `light` binary sensor that will track when the area's aggregate illuminance goes over this threshold. Requires the device class `illuminance` to be selected for aggregation. Set to 0 to disable.
data_description.aggregates_illuminance_threshold_hystere: [Hysteresis](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/threshold/#hysteresis) defines how sensitive the sensor is to changes on its value. A value of zero will flip the sensor state whenever the illuminance crosses the threshold above. Positive values means that the sensor will only change state if the threshold is surpassed by a given amount, expressed in percentage of the threshold set above. Ramping up this value might be useful if you're trying to use this sensor as its own area's light sensor.

feature_conf_fan_groups.title: Feature: Fan Groups
feature_conf_fan_groups.description: Group and control all fan entities in an area. This feature allows fan entities to be controlled automatically according to an area's state and wether the aggregate sensor value crosses a setpoint. Fan control requires the aggregates feature to be enable and corresponding device classses selected.

data_description.required_state: State the area has to have in order to consider turning on the fan group.
data_description.tracked_device_class: Select which aggregate device class to track for value changes.
data_description.setpoint: Number which the tracked aggregate sensor must be equal or greater in order to turn on the fan group.

feature_conf_climate_control.title: Feature: Climate Control > Entity Selection
feature_conf_climate_control.description: Select the climate entity that you would like to be controlled through area states.

feature_conf_climate_control_select_pres.title: Feature: Climate Control > Preset Mapping
feature_conf_climate_control_select_pres.description: Control a climate entity by mapping presets to the area state. `extended` state takes priority over `occupied` and `sleep` state takes priority over `extended` and `occupied`. Map a state to an empty preset to disable changing presets for that state.

data_description.preset_clear: Preset to be changed when on `clear` state.
data_description.preset_occupied: Preset to be changed when on `occupied` state.
data_description.preset_sleep: Preset to be changed when on `sleep` state.
data_description.preset_extended: Preset to be changed when on `extended` state.

feature_conf_ble_trackers.title: BLE Tracker Integration
feature_conf_ble_trackers.description: Tracks sensors from BLE Trackers and creates a corresponding `occupancy` binary sensor for the area that is turned on when the BLE tracker sensor has a state equals to the area's name or ID. **This feature does _NOT_ perform BLE Tracking itself.**

data.ble_tracker_entities: Entities from BLE Trackers to track.

data_description.ble_tracker_entities: BLE Trackers such as [room-assistant](https://github.com/mKeRix/room-assistant), [Bermuda](https://github.com/agittins/bermuda) and [ESPresence](https://github.com/ESPresense/ESPresense) creates sensors which changes state to whatever area the device was closer to.

feature_conf_wasp_in_a_box.title: Wasp in a Box
feature_conf_wasp_in_a_box.description: If we see a wasp, then there is a wasp in the box. If we close the box while there is a wasp in the box, then the wasp remains in the box. If the box remains closed when there is a wasp in the box, and the wasp stops moving, we assume it's still in the box. If the box is opened, and the wasp is not moving, we assume that the wasp has escaped (there is no wasp in the box). This feature monitors your `door` aggregates as the box and your `motion` (default) aggregates as your wasp. A new `binary_sensor` will be created and automatically tracked for presence.

data_description.delay: Time to wait before checking for wasps after a box changing state. Set to 0 to disable.
data_description.wasp_timeout: If greater than 0, wasp will be 'forgotten' after being inactive for this long.
data_description.wasp_device_classes: If you wish other aggregates to be considered as wasps, please select from the list.

secondary_states.title: Advanced area state tracking
secondary_states.description: You can enable [secondary states](https://github.com/jseidl/hass-magic_areas/wiki/Area-State) for a Magic Area by assigning an entity to it. Secondary states are used by features for turning lights on only when it's dark or only turning on climate devices after an `extended` period of time or not sending notifications to an area if it's on `sleep`.

data_description.dark_entity:
The area's light sensor will be used to track an area `bright`/`dark` status which is used by features such as Light groups to turn on/off your lights according to the room brightness state.

**Avoid using a `light` sensor in the same area as it may cause a feedback loop.** It is recommended to use either `sun.sun` or an exterior `light` sensor that won't be affected by the lights being controlled.
data_description.sleep_entity: Entity used to track area sleep state
data_description.sleep_timeout: How long area will wait before clearing the state when on sleep state
data_description.accent_entity: Entity used to track area accented state
data_description.extended_time: Area will be marked as 'extended' after being occupied for this long
data_description.extended_timeout: How long area will wait before clearing the state when on extended state
data_description.calculation_mode: Mode of calculating the meta-area secondary states from their children. 'Any' means if any area has the state, 'All' means all areas have to have the state and 'Majority' means >50% of the areas have to have the state.

area_config.title: Basic area options
area_config.description: Configure basic options for the area. Area type is used for the Interior/Exterior/Global [Meta-areas](https://github.com/jseidl/hass-magic_areas/wiki/Meta-Areas) and you can fine-tune which entities are analyzed by Magic Areas by using the include/exclude entities options.

data.reload_on_registry_change: Automatically reload this Magic Area on registry updates

data_description.include_entities: Magic Areas can consider entities from other areas including other Magic entities. You can use this to make a room's presence binary sensor to act as another room's presence sensor as well.
data_description.exclude_entities: Entities listed here will be completely ignored by Magic Areas. Use this if you have entities throwing your data off like device temperature sensors.
data_description.type: Defining an area type allows Meta areas for Interior/Exterior to be created.
data_description.reload_on_registry_change: Automatically reload this Magic Area when any entity or device is assigned or moved to an area.
data_description.ignore_diagnostic_entities: Magic Areas can ignore diagnostic and configuration entities which are usually not relevant.

presence_tracking.title: Presence Tracking
presence_tracking.description: Configure which platforms and binary sensor device classes are used for [presence tracking](https://github.com/jseidl/hass-magic_areas/wiki/Presence-Sensing). This section also allows you to configure how long Magic Area will wait until clearing the area after the last presence event.

data.presence_device_platforms: Platforms to be used for presence sensing

data_description.presence_device_platforms: Binary sensors are usually the standard source of presence but media devices can be used too.
data_description.presence_sensor_device_class: Define which device classes of `binary sensors` will be used for presence tracking. Common non-standard options are door and humidity.
data_description.keep_only_entities: Select presence-tracking entities that will only be considered when the room is already occupied. This is useful for preventing over-sensitive sensors such as mmWave sensors and BLE trackers false-triggering an area's presence.
data_description.clear_timeout: How long since last presence event should it wait before clearing the area
